title: Onboarding
text:
We are primarily located and affiliated with the ANU Biological Data Science Institute (BDSI), as such there are a number of shared resources between ANU AAGI and BDSI.
The team uses the following shared resources:

anu-bdsi GitHub organisation for public team resources (BDSI team only)
anu-aagi GitHub organisation for public team resources (ANU-AAGI team only)
Sharepoint site for private BDSI resources (BDSI staff only)
Sharepoint site for private ANU-AAGI resources (ANU-AAGI staff only)
Microsoft teams for casual chats (any ANU staff) (defunct, replaced by Zulip)
Zulip chat for project and casual chats (ANU-AAGI team + Guests)
Microsoft group for group emails (BDSI staff only)

title: Onboarding
text:
We are primarily located and affiliated with the ANU Biological Data Science Institute (BDSI), as such there are a number of shared resources between ANU AAGI and BDSI.
The team uses the following shared resources:

anu-bdsi GitHub organisation for public team resources (BDSI team only)
anu-aagi GitHub organisation for public team resources (ANU-AAGI team only)

title: Onboarding
text:
How to get added

Send your GitHub username to Emi Tanaka for GitHub organisation.
Send your ANU email address to Jo Bayley or Emi Tanaka to be added for Sharepoint, Microsoft teams, and Microsoft group.

title: Onboarding
text:
Expectations
All ANU staff are required to follow the ANU policies and guidelines, including but not limited to ANU Code of Conduct and ANU Responsible Conduct of Research policy. Those who practice statistics should also follow the ASA‚Äôs Ethical Guidelines for Statistical Practice.
Specific to the AAGI team, we expect team members to:

practice open science (share your code and data openly) when and where reasonable to do so,
document and track activities using features and repos on anu-aagi GitHub organisation for projects,
give and receive constructive feedback, and
acknowledge all contributors.

title: Onboarding
text:
Early careers

Join NECTAR, the network for early-career university workers at ANU.
ANU Integrated AI network may be of an interest. If you want to join the Team channel, ask Emi Tanaka to add you.
You may occassionally want to check out ANU Agrifood Innovation Institute and ANU Statistics Research Group for news and events. The event notices are usually mailed to BDSI members.

title: Onboarding
text:
Conversations and dealing with conflicts
Emi Tanaka, as the ANU-AAGI lead, is responsible for the team‚Äôs operation and reporting. In general, if there any concerns, please feel free to talk to Emi Tanaka. You can find a time to meet with her here or email her at emi.tanaka@anu.edu.au. She is generally responsive and typically responds within 1-2 working day (if it takes longer than that, she may genuinely have missed/misplaced your email so just try again). If you feel uncomfortable talking to Emi Tanaka, you can talk to another faculty staff member (Emi‚Äôs go-to person is Alan Welsh) or Jo Bayley, if they are available and willing.
Naturally, with more people involved, conflicts are inevitable. Conflicts are not necessary bad (in fact, can be a source of innovation and creativity), but it‚Äôs important to resolve it. We encourage you to talk to the person directly face-to-face (rather than having an emotionally charged email/text message exchanges) if you have a concern. If you feel uncomfortable doing so, you can talk to Emi Tanaka to mediate the conversation. In general, focus on what you can control rather than things you can‚Äôt.

title: Onboarding
text:
Meetings
In addition to one-to-one meetings and small group meetings, the team has a number of regular meetings. You are expected to attend the meetings marked with a *. Other meetings are something that you may want to attend if you are interested.








Meeting
When
Description




AAGI Meeting*
Once a week
1-1.5 hour meeting AAGI members only


BDSI External/Internal Forum*
Once a week
1-1.5 hour meeting


RSFAS Statistics Seminar
Usually on Thu 11am
1 hour seminar, followed by catered lunch


ACT Branch of the Statistical Society of Australia
Last Tuesday of the month

title: Job alert üì¢ Seeking 3 postdocs
text:
We are looking for 3 postdoctoral or research fellows with experience in statistics, data science, machine learning, bioinformatics, quantitative biology, or closely related fields. Candidates must possess strong scientific programming skills, demonstrated experience working with real data, and a substantial commitment to reproducible and transparent workflows.
The three postdocs will be part of our institute working on the ‚ÄúAnalytics for the Australian Grains Industry‚Äù project each working on one of the following topics:

Statistical design and modelling,
Bioinformatics and molecular phenotyping, or
Machine learning and image analytics.

The job application closes on Jan 19 2025 23:55 AEDT. The term of employment is up to 3 years (up to 31st December 2027).
For more details see here.

title: Welcome to Patrick!
text:
We are excited to welcome Patrick Li, who will be working in the area of image analytics, machine learning and phenotyping methods.
Patrick, who moved from Melbourne, has developed computer vision models for automating reading of residual plots, implemented as the R package autovi. He also created the spotoroo R package, an algorithm designed to cluster satellite hot spot spatio-temporal data. His work on spotoroo earned him a software award.

title: Contact
text:
Zulip
The ANU-AAGI team communicate via Zulip (an open-source chat tool). If you are part of ANU and would like to join this Zulip channel, please contact the ANU-AAGI lead. We are interested in consolidating analytical expertise to solve agricultural problems across ANU.
https://anu-aagi.zulipchat.com/

title: Contact
text:
Location
The administrative home of BDSI and its staff is located in Building #46 - Robertson.





Internet Provider

title: About
text:
ANU-AAGI is a research collaboration with the Strategic Partners of the Analytics for the Australian Grains Industry (AAGI) funded by the Grains Research Development Coorperation (GRDC). ANU officially joined AAGI at the end of 2024.
If you are part of ANU and would like to be involved (now or in future), please reach out to the ANU lead. We are interested in consolidating analytical expertise to solve agricultural problems across ANU.

title: Welcome To My Blog
text:
This is the first post in a Quarto blog. Welcome!

Since this post doesn‚Äôt specify an explicit image, the first image in the post will be used in the listing page of posts.

title: Welcome to Fonti!
text:
We‚Äôre excited to have Fonti Kar join the team, working in the area of experimental design and statistical modelling for comparative agricultural experiments.
Fonti has a wealth of experience in R programming and developing tools that aid research for others, in addition to her experience in evolutionary ecology where she quantified the heritability of traits from her lizard breeding experiment. She‚Äôs the lead developer for the austraits R package, which won a software award. We‚Äôre looking forward to working with her and the new perspectives and ideas she will bring to the project!
